thread.title: White House Staff Skipping Correspondents’ Dinner in ‘Solidarity’ With Trump
thread.title_full: White House Staff Skipping Correspondents’ Dinner in ‘Solidarity’ With Trump

author: Lindsey Ellefson
title: White House Staff Skipping Correspondents’ Dinner in ‘Solidarity’ With Trump
text:
White House Staff Skipping Correspondents’ Dinner in ‘Solidarity’ With Trump by Lindsey Ellefson | 8:09 pm, March 28th, 2017 
— Hadas Gold (@Hadas_Gold) March 28, 2017 
Donald Trump announced he wouldn’t be attending the White House Correspondents’ Dinner — and now his staff is following suit. 
According to multiple reporters on Twitter, the White House staff will be skipping the huge event in “solidarity” with the President. White House staff will *not* attend this year’s White House Correspondents’ Dinner, in ‘solidarity’ with President Trump, WHCA announces… 
— Dylan Byers (@DylanByers) March 28, 2017 
In an email from White House Correspondents’ Association president Jeff Mason , it was made clear that the board is upset about the decision, and still wants the administration to know that everyone from the White House is welcome. Mason added that “only the White House can speak to the signal it wants to send with this decision.” 
There is still plenty to look forward to, however, including scholarships that will be awarded to student journalists and CNN employees bringing journalism majors in place of celebrity guests. 
[image: screengrab]
